Chicago, IL 60637
nahime@uchicago.edu
EDUCATION:
The University of Chicago
Chicago, IL

text.i: Specialization in Mental Health and Personality

page.text: EXPERIENCE:
Workforce Development & Disabilities Services Liaison Intern, Chinese Mutual Aid Association
June 2014-Present
 Built and maintained relationships with new and existing employers
 Represented CMAA at ADOPT (Asians with Disabilities Outreach Project Think-Tank)
town hall meetings
 Contributed to client recruitment, in-take, testing, and skills assessments
 Counseled and provided case management for clients seeking rehabilitation services
 Developed and edited publications to increase mental health rights awareness
Social Media Intern, Mental Health America of Illinois
Sept-Dec 2014
 Increased social media outreach on Facebook and Twitter by 47%
 Coordinated the curation of an art exhibit, Manifesting Healthy Futures: 24/7 Voices and
Visions of Wellness, for fundraising purposes
 Distributed information on mental health advocacy to the Greater Chicago area
Political Affairs Intern, The Borgen Project
June-Sept 2014
 Mobilized individuals to contact members of Congress in support of key poverty-
reduction legislation
 Represented The Borgen Project at business, political and community events
 Wrote letters of support for key poverty-reduction programs to political leaders and
media
Front Office Aide, Santos Livas Elementary School
Aug-Sept 2013, 2014
Implemented new file system to facilitate recordkeeping
Crafted school-wide and take home correspondences in both English and Spanish
Applied bilingual customer service techniques to facilitate parent relations with the
administration
Aided teachers in administering bilingual in-class activities, tests, and assignments of
various subjects
LEADERSHIP:
Wellness Advisory Board: Advocates for the health wellness for students with disabilities.
SKILLS:
Languages: Fluent in reading, writing, and speaking Spanish
